channel.title: [Delta]∞ energy!(no commands)

item.title: [Delta]∞ energy!(no commands)
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“King JC, post:29, topic:529789”][quote author=Pker DX link=topic=648544.msg4370573#msg4370573 date=1380520927]

if (playerEnergy < 100 && System.currentTimeMillis() - lastIncrease >= 1) { playerEnergy == 100; WriteEnergy(); lastIncrease = System.currentTimeMillis(); }
Change your energy increasing method to that (much easier, sets energy to 100 every 0.001 seconds.
Before I get stupid haters 'nice process lag’
It doesn’t use process.

Wow that must be the stupidst way to handle this.

It’s the easiest way that I can think of, even though I use it.
It actually doesn’t cause lag either.
[/quote]

Because you’re the only player online most likely. Ty it with 100 players every millisecond. At the very least you should have it happening every CYCLE_TIME.[/quote]Most of the servers developed dont event reach 50+ so no really need to worry bout that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]∞ energy!(no commands)
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:1, topic:529789”]Alright first you want to explore your source

First open up player.java and search for this

You should fiind something like this

[code] } else {
// send “running packet”
str.writeBits(2, 2);
// updateType
str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir1]);
str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir2]);
if (updateRequired)
str.writeBits(1, 1);
// tell client there’s an update block appended at the end
else
str.writeBits(1, 0);
if (playerEnergy > 0) {
playerEnergy -= 1;
} else {
isRunning2 = false;
}
}
}

}[/code]

Now heres what I did

[code] } else {
// send “running packet”
str.writeBits(2, 2);
// updateType
str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir1]);
str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir2]);
if (updateRequired)
str.writeBits(1, 1);
// tell client there’s an update block appended at the end
else
str.writeBits(1, 0);
if (playerEnergy >= 0) {
playerEnergy -= 0;
//} else {
//isRunning2 = false;
}
}
}

}[/code]

See difference? I removed the isRunning2 = false; and also put a equal sign on player energy and now I don’t lose energy. now you won’t see any changes yet. If you want you can remove

//} else { //isRunning2 = false;
I havn’t seen anything wrong with this but its not needed no more since you don’t lose energy.

Now open client.java and search for

You should find this long code

public void WalkTo2(int i, int j) { newWalkCmdSteps = 0; if(++newWalkCmdSteps > 50) newWalkCmdSteps = 0; int k = absX + i; k -= mapRegionX * 8; newWalkCmdX[0] = newWalkCmdY[0] = tmpNWCX[0] = tmpNWCY[0] = 0; int l = absY + j; l -= mapRegionY * 8; isRunning2 = false; isRunning = false; for(this.i = 0; this.i < newWalkCmdSteps; this.i++) { newWalkCmdX[this.i] += k; newWalkCmdY[this.i] += l; } lastWalk = System.currentTimeMillis(); walkDelay = 20000; poimiY = l; poimiX = k; }
Change the isRunning and isRunning2 to this

isRunning2 = true; isRunning = true;

Now final step
go back into player.java and search for

you should find this code

and there should be this code close by too

Just change those codes to this

public boolean isRunning2 = true; public boolean isRunning = true;
Now your all done. You could probably make this way easier, but this isn’t a tut on how to re-code the running and walking, but just changing some variables.

Extra
now in your clickingmost.java

case 153://run if (c.playerEnergy > 0) { c.isRunning2 = true; c.isRunning = true; } break; case 152://walk c.isRunning2 = false; c.isRunning = false; break;
you can change up these cases. For example I change these clicking commands to a xp lock and unlock button
also heres the textHandler crap

c.sendQuest("", 149);//%1% c.sendQuest("", 158);//Move Speed c.sendQuest("", 160);//walk c.sendQuest("", 159);//run

Have fun[/quote]

Read full topic
